{`define('JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY', 'your-secret-key-here');`}
For maximum security, use a strong, unique key generated specifically for this purpose. You can generate a secure key using WordPress's built-in secret key generator or any secure random string generator.

Why am I getting "Authorization header not found" errors?

This error typically occurs when your server configuration doesn't allow the HTTP Authorization header to be passed to PHP. For Apache servers, add the following to your .htaccess file:
{`RewriteEngine on RewriteCond %{HTTP:Authorization} ^(.*) RewriteRule ^(.*) - [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%1]`}

How do I implement token refresh in my application?

To implement token refresh, your application should store both the access token and refresh token securely when received, use the access token for API requests until it expires, and when an API request returns a 401 Unauthorized response, use the refresh token to request a new access token.
{`async function refreshToken() { const refreshToken = localStorage.getItem('jwt_refresh_token'); const response = await fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token/refresh', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ refresh_token: refreshToken }) }); const data = await response.json(); if (data.token) { localStorage.setItem('jwt_access_token', data.token); return true; } return false; }`}

Can I use JWT Authentication Pro with WooCommerce?

Yes, JWT Authentication Pro is fully compatible with the WooCommerce REST API. It provides secure authentication for mobile apps, headless storefronts, and custom integrations that need to access WooCommerce data. Our documentation includes specific guides for WooCommerce implementation scenarios.

How do I upgrade from the free version to Pro?

Upgrading from the free JWT Authentication plugin to JWT Authentication Pro is straightforward:
  1. Purchase a license from our website
  2. Download the Pro version plugin
  3. Deactivate (but don't delete) the free version
  4. Install and activate the Pro version
  5. Enter your license key in the settings
Your existing authentication setup will continue to work, and you'll gain access to the additional features without disrupting your current integrations.

Ensure your JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY matches the key used when tokens were generated

Implement proper token refresh instead of extending token lifetime

Ensure API requests include Authorization header with Bearer token

Configure .htaccess or Nginx to pass Authorization headers to PHP

Configure CORS headers for cross-domain API access

Ensure pretty permalinks are enabled and REST API is accessible

{/* Hero Section */}

JWT Authentication Solutions for Every WordPress Implementation

Discover how JWT Authentication Pro secures different WordPress implementations with the same reliable, standardized authentication system.
{/* Introduction */}
Modern WordPress implementations extend far beyond traditional websites. From headless architectures to mobile applications, each implementation requires secure, reliable API authentication. JWT Authentication Pro provides tailored solutions for every scenario, ensuring your WordPress REST API remains secure regardless of how it's being used.
{/* Headless WordPress */}
Headless WordPress

Secure Headless WordPress Implementations

Connect modern JavaScript frontends to WordPress with enterprise-grade authentication. Headless WordPress architectures separate the frontend (built with React, Vue, Next.js, etc.) from the WordPress backend. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal solution for headless WordPress implementations, enabling secure communication between your JavaScript frontend and WordPress REST API.

Cross-Domain Authentication

Seamless authentication across different domains without CORS issues

Framework Compatibility

Works with all major JavaScript frameworks and static site generators

Performance Optimization

Minimizes authentication overhead for faster page loads
React
+ WordPress
} fade={['bottom']} />

React Authentication Example

{`// React authentication example async function loginUser(credentials) { const response = await fetch('https://your-wordpress-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(credentials) }); const data = await response.json(); if (data.token) { // Store tokens securely localStorage.setItem('accessToken', data.token); localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', data.refreshToken); return true; } return false; }`}
{/* Mobile Applications */}
Mobile Applications

Secure Mobile App Authentication

Connect iOS and Android applications to WordPress with reliable, efficient authentication. Mobile applications require secure, efficient authentication mechanisms that don't rely on cookies or sessions. JWT Authentication Pro provides the perfect solution for WordPress-powered mobile apps, enabling secure API access while maintaining a seamless user experience.

Native App Compatibility

Designed for iOS and Android application authentication

Offline Capabilities

Support for offline authentication with proper token management

Secure Token Storage

Best practices for secure token storage in mobile environments
📱
Mobile Apps
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* WooCommerce Integration */}
WooCommerce Integration

Secure WooCommerce API Authentication

Protect sensitive customer and order data when integrating WooCommerce with external systems. WooCommerce stores need robust API security, especially when exposing product, order, or customer data to external applications or services. JWT Authentication Pro provides enterprise-grade security for WooCommerce API access, ensuring only authorized systems can access sensitive data.

Secure Customer Data

Protect sensitive customer information with robust authentication

Order Processing Security

Secure order creation and management via API

Multi-channel Integration

Securely connect WooCommerce to POS systems and marketplaces
🛒
WooCommerce
} fade={['bottom']} />

WooCommerce Integration Example

{`// PHP example for external system integration function get_woocommerce_orders($status = 'processing') { $token = get_stored_jwt_token(); if (!$token || is_token_expired($token)) { $token = refresh_jwt_token(); if (!$token) { $token = authenticate_with_wordpress(); if (!$token) { throw new Exception('Authentication failed'); } } } $response = wp_remote_get( 'https://your-store.com/wp-json/wc/v3/orders?status=' . $status, [ 'headers' => [ 'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $token ] ] ); return json_decode(wp_remote_retrieve_body($response), true); }`}
{/* Multi-site Networks */}
Multi-site Networks

Unified Multi-site Authentication

Implement consistent authentication across WordPress multi-site networks with centralized control. WordPress multi-site networks face unique authentication challenges, especially when building custom dashboards or tools that work across sites. JWT Authentication Pro provides a unified authentication mechanism across the entire network, with centralized management and monitoring.

Network-wide Authentication

Single authentication system across all network sites

Centralized Management

Manage all authentication tokens from the network admin dashboard

Cross-site API Access

Seamlessly access APIs across different sites in the network
🌐
Multi-site
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Single Page Applications */}
Single Page Applications

Seamless SPA Authentication

Integrate single-page applications with WordPress using modern authentication patterns. Single-page applications (SPAs) built with frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular require seamless authentication that doesn't disrupt the user experience. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal authentication solution for SPAs, enabling secure API access without page refreshes or redirects.

Seamless User Experience

Maintain the fluid SPA experience with background authentication

State Management Integration

Easily integrate with Redux, Vuex, or other state management libraries

Route Protection

Secure routes in your SPA based on authentication status
⚡
SPAs
} fade={['bottom']} />

Vue.js SPA Authentication Example

{`// Vue.js authentication example with Vuex const actions = { async login({ commit }, credentials) { try { const response = await axios.post('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', credentials); const { token, refresh_token, user_email, user_display_name } = response.data; const user = { email: user_email, displayName: user_display_name }; // Store in localStorage localStorage.setItem('token', token); localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', refresh_token); // Update state commit('setAuth', { token, refreshToken: refresh_token, user }); // Set default Authorization header axios.defaults.headers.common['Authorization'] = \`Bearer \${token}\`; return true; } catch (error) { console.error('Login failed:', error); return false; } } };`}

{/* Hero Section */}

JWT Authentication Solutions for Every WordPress Implementation

Discover how JWT Authentication Pro secures different WordPress implementations with the same reliable, standardized authentication system.
{/* Introduction */}
Modern WordPress implementations extend far beyond traditional websites. From headless architectures to mobile applications, each implementation requires secure, reliable API authentication. JWT Authentication Pro provides tailored solutions for every scenario, ensuring your WordPress REST API remains secure regardless of how it's being used.
{/* Headless WordPress */}
Headless WordPress

Secure Headless WordPress Implementations

Connect modern JavaScript frontends to WordPress with enterprise-grade authentication. Headless WordPress architectures separate the frontend (built with React, Vue, Next.js, etc.) from the WordPress backend. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal solution for headless WordPress implementations, enabling secure communication between your JavaScript frontend and WordPress REST API.

Cross-Domain Authentication

Seamless authentication across different domains without CORS issues

Framework Compatibility

Works with all major JavaScript frameworks and static site generators

Performance Optimization

Minimizes authentication overhead for faster page loads
React
+ WordPress
} fade={['bottom']} />

React Authentication Example

{`// React authentication example async function loginUser(credentials) { const response = await fetch('https://your-wordpress-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(credentials) }); const data = await response.json(); if (data.token) { // Store tokens securely localStorage.setItem('accessToken', data.token); localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', data.refreshToken); return true; } return false; }`}
{/* Mobile Applications */}
Mobile Applications

Secure Mobile App Authentication

Connect iOS and Android applications to WordPress with reliable, efficient authentication. Mobile applications require secure, efficient authentication mechanisms that don't rely on cookies or sessions. JWT Authentication Pro provides the perfect solution for WordPress-powered mobile apps, enabling secure API access while maintaining a seamless user experience.

Native App Compatibility

Designed for iOS and Android application authentication

Offline Capabilities

Support for offline authentication with proper token management

Secure Token Storage

Best practices for secure token storage in mobile environments
📱
Mobile Apps
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* WooCommerce Integration */}
WooCommerce Integration

Secure WooCommerce API Authentication

Protect sensitive customer and order data when integrating WooCommerce with external systems. WooCommerce stores need robust API security, especially when exposing product, order, or customer data to external applications or services. JWT Authentication Pro provides enterprise-grade security for WooCommerce API access, ensuring only authorized systems can access sensitive data.

Secure Customer Data

Protect sensitive customer information with robust authentication

Order Processing Security

Secure order creation and management via API

Multi-channel Integration

Securely connect WooCommerce to POS systems and marketplaces
🛒
WooCommerce
} fade={['bottom']} />

WooCommerce Integration Example

{`// PHP example for external system integration function get_woocommerce_orders($status = 'processing') { $token = get_stored_jwt_token(); if (!$token || is_token_expired($token)) { $token = refresh_jwt_token(); if (!$token) { $token = authenticate_with_wordpress(); if (!$token) { throw new Exception('Authentication failed'); } } } $response = wp_remote_get( 'https://your-store.com/wp-json/wc/v3/orders?status=' . $status, [ 'headers' => [ 'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $token ] ] ); return json_decode(wp_remote_retrieve_body($response), true); }`}
{/* Multi-site Networks */}
Multi-site Networks

Unified Multi-site Authentication

Implement consistent authentication across WordPress multi-site networks with centralized control. WordPress multi-site networks face unique authentication challenges, especially when building custom dashboards or tools that work across sites. JWT Authentication Pro provides a unified authentication mechanism across the entire network, with centralized management and monitoring.

Network-wide Authentication

Single authentication system across all network sites

Centralized Management

Manage all authentication tokens from the network admin dashboard

Cross-site API Access

Seamlessly access APIs across different sites in the network
🌐
Multi-site
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Single Page Applications */}
Single Page Applications

Seamless SPA Authentication

Integrate single-page applications with WordPress using modern authentication patterns. Single-page applications (SPAs) built with frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular require seamless authentication that doesn't disrupt the user experience. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal authentication solution for SPAs, enabling secure API access without page refreshes or redirects.

Seamless User Experience

Maintain the fluid SPA experience with background authentication

State Management Integration

Easily integrate with Redux, Vuex, or other state management libraries

Route Protection

Secure routes in your SPA based on authentication status
⚡
SPAs
} fade={['bottom']} />

Vue.js SPA Authentication Example

{`// Vue.js authentication example with Vuex const actions = { async login({ commit }, credentials) { try { const response = await axios.post('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', credentials); const { token, refresh_token, user_email, user_display_name } = response.data; const user = { email: user_email, displayName: user_display_name }; // Store in localStorage localStorage.setItem('token', token); localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', refresh_token); // Update state commit('setAuth', { token, refreshToken: refresh_token, user }); // Set default Authorization header axios.defaults.headers.common['Authorization'] = \`Bearer \${token}\`; return true; } catch (error) { console.error('Login failed:', error); return false; } } };`}
{/* CTA Section */}

Ready to implement JWT authentication for your WordPress project?

Join thousands of developers who trust JWT Authentication Pro to secure their WordPress implementations with enterprise-grade authentication.

) }

{/* Hero Section */}

Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress

Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide.
{/* Introduction */}
JWT Authentication Pro delivers a complete authentication solution for your WordPress REST API, combining enterprise-grade security with developer-friendly implementation. Our feature set is designed to address the real-world challenges of API authentication while providing the tools developers need to implement, manage, and monitor authentication effectively.
{/* Token Management Dashboard */}
} className="lg:col-span-2" fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Token Functionality */}
Advanced Token Functionality

Generate, validate, and refresh tokens with enterprise-grade security

Token Generation

Authenticate users and issue JWT tokens with a single API call. Receive both access and refresh tokens in one seamless response.

Token Validation

Ensure complete security with built-in JWT validation. Verify token signatures and claims to confirm authenticity and expiration status.

Token Refresh

Keep users authenticated without compromising security with our advanced token refresh mechanism and dual-token system.

Example: Token Generation

{`// Request a token $response = wp_remote_post( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', [ 'body' => [ 'username' => $username, 'password' => $password ] ]); // Response includes access and refresh tokens $tokens = json_decode( wp_remote_retrieve_body( $response ) );`}
{/* Security Features */}
Enterprise-Grade Security

Protect your WordPress REST API with advanced security features

} fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Analytics & Monitoring */}
Comprehensive Analytics & Monitoring

Gain actionable insights into API usage and authentication patterns

} fade={['bottom']} />

Authentication Analytics

Track successful and failed authentication attempts over time

Token Usage Metrics

Monitor how tokens are being used across your API

User Activity Reports

View API activity by user to identify patterns and anomalies

Security Event Logging

Maintain a complete audit trail of security-relevant events
{/* Developer Tools */}
Comprehensive Developer Tools

Accelerate implementation and troubleshooting

JWT Authentication Pro includes a suite of developer tools that simplify implementation, testing, and troubleshooting. These tools help you get up and running quickly while ensuring your authentication system is properly configured and functioning as expected.

Token Debugger

Inspect and validate tokens to understand their structure and contents

Authentication Tester

Test authentication flows without writing code

Request Logger

View detailed logs of authentication-related requests for troubleshooting

Configuration Validator

Verify your JWT configuration is secure and properly implemented

{/* FAQ Section */} {/* CTA Section */}

{/* Hero Section */}

Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress

Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide.
{/* Introduction */}
JWT Authentication Pro delivers a complete authentication solution for your WordPress REST API, combining enterprise-grade security with developer-friendly implementation. Our feature set is designed to address the real-world challenges of API authentication while providing the tools developers need to implement, manage, and monitor authentication effectively.
{/* Token Management Dashboard */}
} className="lg:col-span-2" fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Token Functionality */}
Advanced Token Functionality

Generate, validate, and refresh tokens with enterprise-grade security

Token Generation

Authenticate users and issue JWT tokens with a single API call. Receive both access and refresh tokens in one seamless response.

Token Validation

Ensure complete security with built-in JWT validation. Verify token signatures and claims to confirm authenticity and expiration status.

Token Refresh

Keep users authenticated without compromising security with our advanced token refresh mechanism and dual-token system.

Example: Token Generation

{`// Request a token $response = wp_remote_post( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', [ 'body' => [ 'username' => $username, 'password' => $password ] ]); // Response includes access and refresh tokens $tokens = json_decode( wp_remote_retrieve_body( $response ) );`}
{/* Security Features */}
Enterprise-Grade Security

Protect your WordPress REST API with advanced security features

} fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Analytics & Monitoring */}
Comprehensive Analytics & Monitoring

Gain actionable insights into API usage and authentication patterns

} fade={['bottom']} />

Authentication Analytics

Track successful and failed authentication attempts over time

Token Usage Metrics

Monitor how tokens are being used across your API

User Activity Reports

View API activity by user to identify patterns and anomalies

Security Event Logging

Maintain a complete audit trail of security-relevant events
{/* Developer Tools */}
Comprehensive Developer Tools

Accelerate implementation and troubleshooting

JWT Authentication Pro includes a suite of developer tools that simplify implementation, testing, and troubleshooting. These tools help you get up and running quickly while ensuring your authentication system is properly configured and functioning as expected.

Token Debugger

Inspect and validate tokens to understand their structure and contents

Authentication Tester

Test authentication flows without writing code

Request Logger

View detailed logs of authentication-related requests for troubleshooting

Configuration Validator

Verify your JWT configuration is secure and properly implemented
{/* Feature Comparison */}
Free vs. Pro Comparison

Complete Feature Comparison

Feature Free Version JWT Auth Pro
Basic JWT Authentication ✓ ✓
Token Refresh Mechanism ✗ ✓
Token Management Dashboard ✗ ✓
Analytics & Monitoring ✗ ✓
Developer Tools ✗ ✓
Premium Support ✗ ✓
{/* FAQ Section */} {/* CTA Section */}

Join thousands of developers who trust JWT Authentication Pro to secure their WordPress implementations with enterprise-grade authentication.
Starting at just $59.99 for a single site. 30-day money-back guarantee.

import { BentoCard } from '@/components/bento-card' import { Button } from '@/components/button' import { CodeBlock } from '@/components/code-block' import { Container } from '@/components/container' import { Faqs } from '@/components/faqs' import { Footer } from '@/components/footer' import { Gradient } from '@/components/gradient' import { Link } from '@/components/link' import { Screenshot } from '@/components/screenshot' import { Subheading, Text } from '@/components/text' import type { Metadata } from 'next' export const metadata: Metadata = { title: 'Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress | JWT Auth Pro', description: 'Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide. Token management, security features, analytics, and developer tools.', } export default function Features() { return (
{/* Hero Section */}

Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress

Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide.
{/* Introduction */}
JWT Authentication Pro delivers a complete authentication solution for your WordPress REST API, combining enterprise-grade security with developer-friendly implementation. Our feature set is designed to address the real-world challenges of API authentication while providing the tools developers need to implement, manage, and monitor authentication effectively.
{/* Token Management Dashboard */}
} className="lg:col-span-2" fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Token Functionality */}
Advanced Token Functionality

Generate, validate, and refresh tokens with enterprise-grade security

Token Generation

Authenticate users and issue JWT tokens with a single API call. Receive both access and refresh tokens in one seamless response.

Token Validation

Ensure complete security with built-in JWT validation. Verify token signatures and claims to confirm authenticity and expiration status.

Token Refresh

Keep users authenticated without compromising security with our advanced token refresh mechanism and dual-token system.

Example: Token Generation

{`// Request a token $response = wp_remote_post( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', [ 'body' => [ 'username' => $username, 'password' => $password ] ]); // Response includes access and refresh tokens $tokens = json_decode( wp_remote_retrieve_body( $response ) );`}
{/* Security Features */}
Enterprise-Grade Security

Protect your WordPress REST API with advanced security features

} fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Analytics & Monitoring */}
Comprehensive Analytics & Monitoring

Gain actionable insights into API usage and authentication patterns

} fade={['bottom']} />

Authentication Analytics

Track successful and failed authentication attempts over time

Token Usage Metrics

Monitor how tokens are being used across your API

User Activity Reports

View API activity by user to identify patterns and anomalies

Security Event Logging

Maintain a complete audit trail of security-relevant events
{/* Developer Tools */}
Comprehensive Developer Tools

Accelerate implementation and troubleshooting

JWT Authentication Pro includes a suite of developer tools that simplify implementation, testing, and troubleshooting. These tools help you get up and running quickly while ensuring your authentication system is properly configured and functioning as expected.

Token Debugger

Inspect and validate tokens to understand their structure and contents

Authentication Tester

Test authentication flows without writing code

Request Logger

View detailed logs of authentication-related requests for troubleshooting

Configuration Validator

Verify your JWT configuration is secure and properly implemented
{/* Feature Comparison */}
Free vs. Pro Comparison

Complete Feature Comparison

Feature Free Version JWT Auth Pro
Basic JWT Authentication ✓ ✓
Token Refresh Mechanism ✗ ✓
Token Management Dashboard ✗ ✓
Analytics & Monitoring ✗ ✓
Developer Tools ✗ ✓
Premium Support ✗ ✓
{/* FAQ Section */} {/* CTA Section */}

Ready to implement professional JWT authentication?

Join thousands of developers who trust JWT Authentication Pro to secure their WordPress implementations with enterprise-grade authentication.
Starting at just $59.99 for a single site. 30-day money-back guarantee.

content.text:
Perfect! I have successfully completed the task. Here's a summary of the changes made:

## Files Modified

I fixed the Section component usage in the following 4 files:

1. **`/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/pricing/page.tsx`**
2. **`/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/support/page.tsx`**
3. **`/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/solutions/page.tsx`**
4. **`/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/features/page.tsx`**

## Changes Made

### 1. Removed Incorrect Section Component Usage
- Replaced all `<Section>` and `<Section className="py-20 sm:py-32">` with `<div className="py-20 sm:py-32">`
- The Section component requires these props: `icon`, `subtitle`, `title`, `description`, `children`, but these files were only using `className` and `children`

### 2. Removed Unused Imports
- Removed `import { Section } from '@/components/section'` from all 4 files

### 3. Preserved All Content and Styling
- All existing content, components, and styling have been preserved
- Applied consistent `py-20 sm:py-32` spacing to match the previous Section usage
- All nested Container components and content remain exactly the same

## Files Not Modified

The following files were **NOT** modified because they either:
- Don't use Section component at all: `_company/page.tsx`, `_pricing/page.tsx`, `about/page.tsx`, `page.tsx`
- Use Section component correctly with required props: (None found - all incorrect usages were fixed)

## Summary

✅ Successfully replaced 28+ incorrect Section component usages across 4 files  
✅ Removed 4 unused Section imports  
✅ Preserved all existing content and styling  
✅ Applied consistent `py-20 sm:py-32` spacing for proper layout  
✅ No breaking changes - all functionality maintained  

The codebase now properly uses simple div elements with appropriate spacing instead of the incorrectly configured Section components, while maintaining the exact same visual appearance and functionality.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
import { BentoCard } from '@/components/bento-card' import { Button } from '@/components/button' import { CodeBlock } from '@/components/code-block' import { Container } from '@/components/container' import { Faqs } from '@/components/faqs' import { Footer } from '@/components/footer' import { Gradient } from '@/components/gradient' import { Link } from '@/components/link' import { Screenshot } from '@/components/screenshot' import { Subheading, Text } from '@/components/text' import type { Metadata } from 'next' export const metadata: Metadata = { title: 'Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress | JWT Auth Pro', description: 'Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide. Token management, security features, analytics, and developer tools.', } export default function Features() { return (
{/* Hero Section */}

Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress

Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide.
{/* Introduction */}
JWT Authentication Pro delivers a complete authentication solution for your WordPress REST API, combining enterprise-grade security with developer-friendly implementation. Our feature set is designed to address the real-world challenges of API authentication while providing the tools developers need to implement, manage, and monitor authentication effectively.
{/* Token Management Dashboard */}
} className="lg:col-span-2" fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Token Functionality */}
Advanced Token Functionality

Generate, validate, and refresh tokens with enterprise-grade security

Token Generation

Authenticate users and issue JWT tokens with a single API call. Receive both access and refresh tokens in one seamless response.

Token Validation

Ensure complete security with built-in JWT validation. Verify token signatures and claims to confirm authenticity and expiration status.

Token Refresh

Keep users authenticated without compromising security with our advanced token refresh mechanism and dual-token system.

Example: Token Generation

{`// Request a token $response = wp_remote_post( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', [ 'body' => [ 'username' => $username, 'password' => $password ] ]); // Response includes access and refresh tokens $tokens = json_decode( wp_remote_retrieve_body( $response ) );`}
{/* Security Features */}
Enterprise-Grade Security

Protect your WordPress REST API with advanced security features

} fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Analytics & Monitoring */}
Comprehensive Analytics & Monitoring

Gain actionable insights into API usage and authentication patterns

} fade={['bottom']} />

Authentication Analytics

Track successful and failed authentication attempts over time

Token Usage Metrics

Monitor how tokens are being used across your API

User Activity Reports

View API activity by user to identify patterns and anomalies

Security Event Logging

Maintain a complete audit trail of security-relevant events
{/* Developer Tools */}
Comprehensive Developer Tools

Accelerate implementation and troubleshooting

JWT Authentication Pro includes a suite of developer tools that simplify implementation, testing, and troubleshooting. These tools help you get up and running quickly while ensuring your authentication system is properly configured and functioning as expected.

Token Debugger

Inspect and validate tokens to understand their structure and contents

Authentication Tester

Test authentication flows without writing code

Request Logger

View detailed logs of authentication-related requests for troubleshooting

Configuration Validator

Verify your JWT configuration is secure and properly implemented
{/* Feature Comparison */}
Free vs. Pro Comparison

Complete Feature Comparison

Feature Free Version JWT Auth Pro
Basic JWT Authentication ✓ ✓
Token Refresh Mechanism ✗ ✓
Token Management Dashboard ✗ ✓
Analytics & Monitoring ✗ ✓
Developer Tools ✗ ✓
Premium Support ✗ ✓
{/* FAQ Section */} {/* CTA Section */}

Ready to implement professional JWT authentication?

Join thousands of developers who trust JWT Authentication Pro to secure their WordPress implementations with enterprise-grade authentication.
Starting at just $59.99 for a single site. 30-day money-back guarantee.
) }

lines: description="Complete visibility and control over all authentication tokens in one centralized interface."
description="View all active tokens with detailed information about creation time, expiration, and last use."

description="Maintain complete control over API access with instant token revocation capabilities. Revoke individual tokens, all tokens for a specific user, or implement automatic revocation based on security events."
description="Enhance security with location-based insights and restrictions. Identify the geographic origin of authentication requests and optionally restrict access based on location parameters."

description="Protect against brute force attacks and API abuse with configurable rate limiting. Set limits on authentication attempts and API requests to prevent malicious activity while ensuring availability for legitimate users."

description="Understanding how your API is being used is essential for security and optimization. JWT Authentication Pro provides comprehensive analytics and monitoring tools that give you visibility into authentication patterns, API usage, and potential security issues."

import { BentoCard } from '@/components/bento-card' import { Button } from '@/components/button' import { CodeBlock } from '@/components/code-block' import { Container } from '@/components/container' import { Faqs } from '@/components/faqs' import { Footer } from '@/components/footer' import { Gradient } from '@/components/gradient' import { Link } from '@/components/link' import { Screenshot } from '@/components/screenshot' import { Subheading, Text } from '@/components/text' import type { Metadata } from 'next' export const metadata: Metadata = { title: 'Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress | JWT Auth Pro', description: 'Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide. Token management, security features, analytics, and developer tools.', } export default function Features() { return (
{/* Hero Section */}

Complete JWT Authentication Features for WordPress

Discover the comprehensive feature set that makes JWT Authentication Pro the preferred solution for securing WordPress REST APIs worldwide.
{/* Introduction */}
JWT Authentication Pro delivers a complete authentication solution for your WordPress REST API, combining enterprise-grade security with developer-friendly implementation. Our feature set is designed to address the real-world challenges of API authentication while providing the tools developers need to implement, manage, and monitor authentication effectively.
{/* Token Management Dashboard */}
} className="lg:col-span-2" fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Token Functionality */}
Advanced Token Functionality

Generate, validate, and refresh tokens with enterprise-grade security

Token Generation

Authenticate users and issue JWT tokens with a single API call. Receive both access and refresh tokens in one seamless response.

Token Validation

Ensure complete security with built-in JWT validation. Verify token signatures and claims to confirm authenticity and expiration status.

Token Refresh

Keep users authenticated without compromising security with our advanced token refresh mechanism and dual-token system.

Example: Token Generation

{`// Request a token $response = wp_remote_post( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', [ 'body' => [ 'username' => $username, 'password' => $password ] ]); // Response includes access and refresh tokens $tokens = json_decode( wp_remote_retrieve_body( $response ) );`}
{/* Security Features */}
Enterprise-Grade Security

Protect your WordPress REST API with advanced security features

} fade={['bottom']} /> } fade={['bottom']} />
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Analytics & Monitoring */}
Comprehensive Analytics & Monitoring

Gain actionable insights into API usage and authentication patterns

} fade={['bottom']} />

Authentication Analytics

Track successful and failed authentication attempts over time

Token Usage Metrics

Monitor how tokens are being used across your API

User Activity Reports

View API activity by user to identify patterns and anomalies

Security Event Logging

Maintain a complete audit trail of security-relevant events
{/* Developer Tools */}
Comprehensive Developer Tools

Accelerate implementation and troubleshooting

JWT Authentication Pro includes a suite of developer tools that simplify implementation, testing, and troubleshooting. These tools help you get up and running quickly while ensuring your authentication system is properly configured and functioning as expected.

Token Debugger

Inspect and validate tokens to understand their structure and contents

Authentication Tester

Test authentication flows without writing code

Request Logger

View detailed logs of authentication-related requests for troubleshooting

Configuration Validator

Verify your JWT configuration is secure and properly implemented
{/* Feature Comparison */}
Free vs. Pro Comparison

Complete Feature Comparison

Feature Free Version JWT Auth Pro
Basic JWT Authentication ✓ ✓
Token Refresh Mechanism ✗ ✓
Token Management Dashboard ✗ ✓
Analytics & Monitoring ✗ ✓
Developer Tools ✗ ✓
Premium Support ✗ ✓
{/* FAQ Section */} {/* CTA Section */}

Ready to implement professional JWT authentication?

Join thousands of developers who trust JWT Authentication Pro to secure their WordPress implementations with enterprise-grade authentication.
Starting at just $59.99 for a single site. 30-day money-back guarantee.

input.description: Fix CodeBlock component usage
input.prompt:
I need to fix all CodeBlock component usages across the project. The CodeBlock component expects a `value` prop with this structure:
```
value: { code: string; language: string; filename?: string }
```

But the pages are currently using it incorrectly like:
```jsx
<CodeBlock language="javascript">{`code here`}</CodeBlock>
```

It should be:
```jsx
<CodeBlock value={{ code: `code here`, language: 'javascript' }} />
```

Please:
1. Find all files that use CodeBlock component incorrectly
2. Convert the usage from children + language props to the correct value prop structure
3. Make sure to preserve all the code content exactly

Return a summary of files modified and the changes made.

{/* Hero Section */}

JWT Authentication Solutions for Every WordPress Implementation

Discover how JWT Authentication Pro secures different WordPress implementations with the same reliable, standardized authentication system.
{/* Introduction */}
Modern WordPress implementations extend far beyond traditional websites. From headless architectures to mobile applications, each implementation requires secure, reliable API authentication. JWT Authentication Pro provides tailored solutions for every scenario, ensuring your WordPress REST API remains secure regardless of how it's being used.
{/* Headless WordPress */}
Headless WordPress

Secure Headless WordPress Implementations

Connect modern JavaScript frontends to WordPress with enterprise-grade authentication. Headless WordPress architectures separate the frontend (built with React, Vue, Next.js, etc.) from the WordPress backend. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal solution for headless WordPress implementations, enabling secure communication between your JavaScript frontend and WordPress REST API.

Cross-Domain Authentication

Seamless authentication across different domains without CORS issues

Framework Compatibility

Performance Optimization

Minimizes authentication overhead for faster page loads

How do I install JWT Authentication Pro?

178 179 JWT Authentication Pro is installed like any WordPress plugin. Simply upload the plugin ZIP file 180 through your WordPress admin panel (Plugins → Add New → Upload Plugin), or extract the ZIP file 181 to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory via FTP. After installation, activate the plugin and navigate to the 182 JWT Authentication Pro settings page to configure your authentication options. 183 184
185 186
187

How do I configure the secret key?

188 189 The secret key is used to sign JWT tokens and is critical for security. We recommend adding 190 the following line to your wp-config.php file: 191 192
193 {`define('JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY', 'your-secret-key-here');`} 194
195 196 For maximum security, use a strong, unique key generated specifically for this purpose. 197 You can generate a secure key using WordPress's built-in secret key generator or any 198 secure random string generator. 199 200
201 202
203

Why am I getting "Authorization header not found" errors?

204 205 This error typically occurs when your server configuration doesn't allow the HTTP Authorization 206 header to be passed to PHP. For Apache servers, add the following to your .htaccess file: 207 208
209 {`RewriteEngine on 210 RewriteCond %{HTTP:Authorization} ^(.*) 211 RewriteRule ^(.*) - [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%1]`} 212
213
214 215
216

How do I implement token refresh in my application?

217 218 To implement token refresh, your application should store both the access token and refresh token 219 securely when received, use the access token for API requests until it expires, and when an API 220 request returns a 401 Unauthorized response, use the refresh token to request a new access token. 221 222
223 {`async function refreshToken() { 224 const refreshToken = localStorage.getItem('jwt_refresh_token'); 225 226 const response = await fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token/refresh', { 227 method: 'POST', 228 headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, 229 body: JSON.stringify({ refresh_token: refreshToken }) 230 }); 231 232 const data = await response.json(); 233 234 if (data.token) { 235 localStorage.setItem('jwt_access_token', data.token); 236 return true; 237 } 238 239 return false; 240 }`} 241
242

245

Can I use JWT Authentication Pro with WooCommerce?

246 247 Yes, JWT Authentication Pro is fully compatible with the WooCommerce REST API. It provides 248 secure authentication for mobile apps, headless storefronts, and custom integrations that 249 need to access WooCommerce data. Our documentation includes specific guides for WooCommerce 250 implementation scenarios. 251 252
253 254

256 257 Upgrading from the free JWT Authentication plugin to JWT Authentication Pro is straightforward: 258 259
    260
  1. Purchase a license from our website
    2. 261
  2. Download the Pro version plugin
    3. 262
  3. Deactivate (but don't delete) the free version
    4. 263
  4. Install and activate the Pro version
    5. 264
  5. Enter your license key in the settings
    6. 265
266 267 Your existing authentication setup will continue to work, and you'll gain access to the 268 additional features without disrupting your current integrations. 269 270

Common Questions & Solutions

How do I install JWT Authentication Pro?

JWT Authentication Pro is installed like any WordPress plugin. Simply upload the plugin ZIP file through your WordPress admin panel (Plugins → Add New → Upload Plugin), or extract the ZIP file to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory via FTP. After installation, activate the plugin and navigate to the JWT Authentication Pro settings page to configure your authentication options.

How do I configure the secret key?

The secret key is used to sign JWT tokens and is critical for security. We recommend adding the following line to your wp-config.php file:
{`define('JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY', 'your-secret-key-here');`}
For maximum security, use a strong, unique key generated specifically for this purpose. You can generate a secure key using WordPress's built-in secret key generator or any secure random string generator.

Why am I getting "Authorization header not found" errors?

This error typically occurs when your server configuration doesn't allow the HTTP Authorization header to be passed to PHP. For Apache servers, add the following to your .htaccess file:
{`RewriteEngine on RewriteCond %{HTTP:Authorization} ^(.*) RewriteRule ^(.*) - [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%1]`}

How do I implement token refresh in my application?

To implement token refresh, your application should store both the access token and refresh token securely when received, use the access token for API requests until it expires, and when an API request returns a 401 Unauthorized response, use the refresh token to request a new access token.
{`async function refreshToken() { const refreshToken = localStorage.getItem('jwt_refresh_token'); const response = await fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token/refresh', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ refresh_token: refreshToken }) }); const data = await response.json(); if (data.token) { localStorage.setItem('jwt_access_token', data.token); return true; } return false; }`}

Can I use JWT Authentication Pro with WooCommerce?

Yes, JWT Authentication Pro is fully compatible with the WooCommerce REST API. It provides secure authentication for mobile apps, headless storefronts, and custom integrations that need to access WooCommerce data. Our documentation includes specific guides for WooCommerce implementation scenarios.

How do I upgrade from the free version to Pro?

Upgrading from the free JWT Authentication plugin to JWT Authentication Pro is straightforward:
  1. Purchase a license from our website
  2. Download the Pro version plugin
  3. Deactivate (but don't delete) the free version
  4. Install and activate the Pro version
  5. Enter your license key in the settings
Your existing authentication setup will continue to work, and you'll gain access to the additional features without disrupting your current integrations.

<CodeBlock language="javascript">{`// React authentication example
async function loginUser(credentials) {
  const response = await fetch('https://your-wordpress-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', {
    method: 'POST',
    headers: {
      'Content-Type': 'application/json'
    },
    body: JSON.stringify(credentials)
  });

  const data = await response.json();

  if (data.token) {
    // Store tokens securely
    localStorage.setItem('accessToken', data.token);
    localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', data.refreshToken);
    return true;
  }

  return false;
}`}</CodeBlock>

{/* Hero Section */}

JWT Authentication Solutions for Every WordPress Implementation

Discover how JWT Authentication Pro secures different WordPress implementations with the same reliable, standardized authentication system.
{/* Introduction */}
Modern WordPress implementations extend far beyond traditional websites. From headless architectures to mobile applications, each implementation requires secure, reliable API authentication. JWT Authentication Pro provides tailored solutions for every scenario, ensuring your WordPress REST API remains secure regardless of how it's being used.
{/* Headless WordPress */}
Headless WordPress

Secure Headless WordPress Implementations

Connect modern JavaScript frontends to WordPress with enterprise-grade authentication. Headless WordPress architectures separate the frontend (built with React, Vue, Next.js, etc.) from the WordPress backend. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal solution for headless WordPress implementations, enabling secure communication between your JavaScript frontend and WordPress REST API.

Cross-Domain Authentication

Seamless authentication across different domains without CORS issues

Framework Compatibility

Works with all major JavaScript frameworks and static site generators

Performance Optimization

Minimizes authentication overhead for faster page loads
React
+ WordPress
} fade={['bottom']} />

React Authentication Example

{`// React authentication example async function loginUser(credentials) { const response = await fetch('https://your-wordpress-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(credentials) }); const data = await response.json(); if (data.token) { // Store tokens securely localStorage.setItem('accessToken', data.token); localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', data.refreshToken); return true; } return false; }`}
{/* Mobile Applications */}
Mobile Applications

Secure Mobile App Authentication

Connect iOS and Android applications to WordPress with reliable, efficient authentication. Mobile applications require secure, efficient authentication mechanisms that don't rely on cookies or sessions. JWT Authentication Pro provides the perfect solution for WordPress-powered mobile apps, enabling secure API access while maintaining a seamless user experience.

Native App Compatibility

Designed for iOS and Android application authentication

Offline Capabilities

Support for offline authentication with proper token management

Secure Token Storage

Best practices for secure token storage in mobile environments
📱
Mobile Apps
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* WooCommerce Integration */}
WooCommerce Integration

Secure WooCommerce API Authentication

Protect sensitive customer and order data when integrating WooCommerce with external systems. WooCommerce stores need robust API security, especially when exposing product, order, or customer data to external applications or services. JWT Authentication Pro provides enterprise-grade security for WooCommerce API access, ensuring only authorized systems can access sensitive data.

Secure Customer Data

Protect sensitive customer information with robust authentication

Order Processing Security

Secure order creation and management via API

Multi-channel Integration

Securely connect WooCommerce to POS systems and marketplaces
🛒
WooCommerce
} fade={['bottom']} />

WooCommerce Integration Example

{`// PHP example for external system integration function get_woocommerce_orders($status = 'processing') { $token = get_stored_jwt_token(); if (!$token || is_token_expired($token)) { $token = refresh_jwt_token(); if (!$token) { $token = authenticate_with_wordpress(); if (!$token) { throw new Exception('Authentication failed'); } } } $response = wp_remote_get( 'https://your-store.com/wp-json/wc/v3/orders?status=' . $status, [ 'headers' => [ 'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $token ] ] ); return json_decode(wp_remote_retrieve_body($response), true); }`}
{/* Multi-site Networks */}
Multi-site Networks

Unified Multi-site Authentication

Implement consistent authentication across WordPress multi-site networks with centralized control. WordPress multi-site networks face unique authentication challenges, especially when building custom dashboards or tools that work across sites. JWT Authentication Pro provides a unified authentication mechanism across the entire network, with centralized management and monitoring.

Network-wide Authentication

Single authentication system across all network sites

Centralized Management

Manage all authentication tokens from the network admin dashboard

Cross-site API Access

Seamlessly access APIs across different sites in the network
🌐
Multi-site
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* Single Page Applications */}
Single Page Applications

Seamless SPA Authentication

Integrate single-page applications with WordPress using modern authentication patterns. Single-page applications (SPAs) built with frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular require seamless authentication that doesn't disrupt the user experience. JWT Authentication Pro provides the ideal authentication solution for SPAs, enabling secure API access without page refreshes or redirects.

Seamless User Experience

Maintain the fluid SPA experience with background authentication

State Management Integration

Route Protection

Secure routes in your SPA based on authentication status
⚡
SPAs
} fade={['bottom']} />

{`// Vue.js authentication example with Vuex const actions = { async login({ commit }, credentials) { try { const response = await axios.post('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', credentials); const { token, refresh_token, user_email, user_display_name } = response.data; const user = { email: user_email, displayName: user_display_name }; // Store in localStorage localStorage.setItem('token', token); localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', refresh_token); // Update state commit('setAuth', { token, refreshToken: refresh_token, user }); // Set default Authorization header axios.defaults.headers.common['Authorization'] = \`Bearer \${token}\`; return true; } catch (error) { console.error('Login failed:', error); return false; } } };`}

edits.old_string:
<CodeBlock language="php">{`// PHP example for external system integration
function get_woocommerce_orders($status = 'processing') {
    $token = get_stored_jwt_token();

    if (!$token || is_token_expired($token)) {
        $token = refresh_jwt_token();
        if (!$token) {
            $token = authenticate_with_wordpress();
            if (!$token) {
                throw new Exception('Authentication failed');
            }
        }
    }

    $response = wp_remote_get(
        'https://your-store.com/wp-json/wc/v3/orders?status=' . $status,
        [
            'headers' => [
                'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $token
            ]
        ]
    );

    return json_decode(wp_remote_retrieve_body($response), true);
}`}</CodeBlock>

edits.old_string:
<CodeBlock language="javascript">{`// Vue.js authentication example with Vuex
const actions = {
  async login({ commit }, credentials) {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token', credentials);

      const { token, refresh_token, user_email, user_display_name } = response.data;

      const user = {
        email: user_email,
        displayName: user_display_name
      };

      // Store in localStorage
      localStorage.setItem('token', token);
      localStorage.setItem('refreshToken', refresh_token);

      // Update state
      commit('setAuth', { token, refreshToken: refresh_token, user });

      // Set default Authorization header
      axios.defaults.headers.common['Authorization'] = \`Bearer \${token}\`;

      return true;
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Login failed:', error);
      return false;
    }
  }
};`}</CodeBlock>

{/* FAQ Section */}
Frequently Asked Questions

Common Questions & Solutions

How do I install JWT Authentication Pro?

JWT Authentication Pro is installed like any WordPress plugin. Simply upload the plugin ZIP file through your WordPress admin panel (Plugins → Add New → Upload Plugin), or extract the ZIP file to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory via FTP. After installation, activate the plugin and navigate to the JWT Authentication Pro settings page to configure your authentication options.

How do I configure the secret key?

The secret key is used to sign JWT tokens and is critical for security. We recommend adding the following line to your wp-config.php file:
{`define('JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY', 'your-secret-key-here');`}
For maximum security, use a strong, unique key generated specifically for this purpose. You can generate a secure key using WordPress's built-in secret key generator or any secure random string generator.

Why am I getting "Authorization header not found" errors?

This error typically occurs when your server configuration doesn't allow the HTTP Authorization header to be passed to PHP. For Apache servers, add the following to your .htaccess file:
{`RewriteEngine on RewriteCond %{HTTP:Authorization} ^(.*) RewriteRule ^(.*) - [E=HTTP_AUTHORIZATION:%1]`}

How do I implement token refresh in my application?

To implement token refresh, your application should store both the access token and refresh token securely when received, use the access token for API requests until it expires, and when an API request returns a 401 Unauthorized response, use the refresh token to request a new access token.
{`async function refreshToken() { const refreshToken = localStorage.getItem('jwt_refresh_token'); const response = await fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/jwt-auth/v1/token/refresh', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ refresh_token: refreshToken }) }); const data = await response.json(); if (data.token) { localStorage.setItem('jwt_access_token', data.token); return true; } return false; }`}

Can I use JWT Authentication Pro with WooCommerce?

Yes, JWT Authentication Pro is fully compatible with the WooCommerce REST API. It provides secure authentication for mobile apps, headless storefronts, and custom integrations that need to access WooCommerce data. Our documentation includes specific guides for WooCommerce implementation scenarios.

How do I upgrade from the free version to Pro?

Upgrading from the free JWT Authentication plugin to JWT Authentication Pro is straightforward:
  1. Purchase a license from our website
  2. Download the Pro version plugin
  3. Deactivate (but don't delete) the free version
  4. Install and activate the Pro version
  5. Enter your license key in the settings
Your existing authentication setup will continue to work, and you'll gain access to the additional features without disrupting your current integrations.
{/* Troubleshooting Guide */}
Troubleshooting

Common Issues & Solutions

Quick fixes for frequently encountered implementation challenges.

Authentication Failures

Token validation fails

Ensure your JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY matches the key used when tokens were generated

Token is expired

Implement proper token refresh instead of extending token lifetime

Token not found

Ensure API requests include Authorization header with Bearer token

Server Configuration

Authorization header issues

Configure .htaccess or Nginx to pass Authorization headers to PHP

CORS errors

Configure CORS headers for cross-domain API access

404 errors on endpoints

Ensure pretty permalinks are enabled and REST API is accessible

content.text:
Perfect! All the CodeBlock components have been successfully converted from the incorrect usage pattern to the correct `value` prop structure.

## Summary

I have successfully fixed all CodeBlock component usages across the project. Here's what was changed:

### Files Modified:

1. **`/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/solutions/page.tsx`** - 3 CodeBlock fixes:
   - React authentication example (line ~120)
   - WooCommerce integration example (line ~275) 
   - Vue.js SPA authentication example (line ~434)

2. **`/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/support/page.tsx`** - 3 CodeBlock fixes:
   - PHP secret key configuration example (line ~193)
   - Apache .htaccess configuration (line ~209)
   - JavaScript token refresh example (line ~223)

### Changes Made:

**Before (incorrect usage):**
```jsx
<CodeBlock language="javascript">{`code here`}</CodeBlock>
```

**After (correct usage):**
```jsx
<CodeBlock value={{ code: `code here`, language: 'javascript' }} />
```

### Files Already Correct:
- `/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/features/page.tsx` - Already using correct `value` prop
- `/Users/tmeister/Code/Personal/jwt-pro/src/app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx` - Already using correct `value` prop

All code content has been preserved exactly as it was, only the prop structure has been changed to match the expected interface of the CodeBlock component. The component now receives a `value` prop with the structure `{ code: string; language: string; filename?: string }` as required.

{/* Hero Section */}

Support Resources for JWT Authentication Pro

Everything you need to implement, troubleshoot, and optimize your JWT authentication. We're committed to helping you successfully implement and maintain JWT Authentication Pro for your WordPress projects. Our comprehensive support resources are designed to address the needs of developers at all skill levels.

{/* Documentation Highlight */}
Complete Documentation

Comprehensive Documentation

Our documentation site at docs.jwtauth.pro provides complete coverage of JWT Authentication Pro, from basic concepts to advanced implementation details.

Getting Started Guide

Quick setup and implementation basics

API Reference

Complete documentation of all endpoints and methods

Integration Guides

Framework-specific implementation instructions

Security Best Practices

Recommendations for secure implementation
} fade={['bottom']} />
{/* FAQ Section */}
Frequently Asked Questions

Common Questions & Solutions

How do I install JWT Authentication Pro?

JWT Authentication Pro is installed like any WordPress plugin. Simply upload the plugin ZIP file through your WordPress admin panel (Plugins → Add New → Upload Plugin), or extract the ZIP file to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory via FTP. After installation, activate the plugin and navigate to the JWT Authentication Pro settings page to configure your authentication options.

How do I configure the secret key?

The secret key is used to sign JWT tokens and is critical for security. We recommend adding the following line to your wp-config.php file:
For maximum security, use a strong, unique key generated specifically for this purpose. You can generate a secure key using WordPress's built-in secret key generator or any secure random string generator.

Why am I getting "Authorization header not found" errors?

This error typically occurs when your server configuration doesn't allow the HTTP Authorization header to be passed to PHP. For Apache servers, add the following to your .htaccess file:

How do I implement token refresh in my application?

To implement token refresh, your application should store both the access token and refresh token securely when received, use the access token for API requests until it expires, and when an API request returns a 401 Unauthorized response, use the refresh token to request a new access token.

Can I use JWT Authentication Pro with WooCommerce?

Yes, JWT Authentication Pro is fully compatible with the WooCommerce REST API. It provides secure authentication for mobile apps, headless storefronts, and custom integrations that need to access WooCommerce data. Our documentation includes specific guides for WooCommerce implementation scenarios.

How do I upgrade from the free version to Pro?

Upgrading from the free JWT Authentication plugin to JWT Authentication Pro is straightforward:
  1. Purchase a license from our website
  2. Download the Pro version plugin
  3. Deactivate (but don't delete) the free version
  4. Install and activate the Pro version
  5. Enter your license key in the settings
Your existing authentication setup will continue to work, and you'll gain access to the additional features without disrupting your current integrations.
{/* Troubleshooting Guide */}
Troubleshooting

Common Issues & Solutions

Quick fixes for frequently encountered implementation challenges.

Authentication Failures

Token validation fails

Ensure your JWT_AUTH_SECRET_KEY matches the key used when tokens were generated

Token is expired

Implement proper token refresh instead of extending token lifetime

Token not found

Ensure API requests include Authorization header with Bearer token

Server Configuration

Authorization header issues

Configure .htaccess or Nginx to pass Authorization headers to PHP

CORS errors

Configure CORS headers for cross-domain API access

404 errors on endpoints

Ensure pretty permalinks are enabled and REST API is accessible

content.text:
Perfect! The build is now successful. All TypeScript errors have been resolved.
